            THIRD READING                          
          CONSENT CALENDAR                         
 Mr. Bosley moved for third reading and final      
 passage of Board Bill No. 288.                    
      Seconded by Ms. Ford-Griffin.                
      Carried by the following vote:               
      Ayes: Troupe, Flowers, Bosley, Moore,        
 Griffin, Young, Ortmann, Vollmer, Villa,          
 Wessels, Florida, Baringer, Roddy, Kennedy,       
 Schmid, Jones-King, Boyd, Hanrahan,               
 Waterhouse, Kirner, Williamson, Carter and        
 Krewson. 23                                       
      Noes: 0                                      
       Abstention: 1 - President Reed abstained    
 to avoid the appearance of a conflict of interest.
       Mr. Bosley moved for third reading and      
 final passage of Board Bill No. 289.              
      Seconded by Ms. Florida.                     
      Carried by the following vote:               
      Ayes: Troupe, Flowers, Bosley, Moore,        
 Griffin, Young, Ortmann, Vollmer, Villa,          
 Wessels, Florida, Baringer, Roddy, Kennedy,       
Schmid, Jones-King, Boyd, Hanrahan,                 
Waterhouse, Kirner, Williamson, Carter and          
Krewson. 23                                         
     Noes: 0                                        
      Abstention: 1 - President Reed abstained      
to avoid the appearance of a conflict of interest.  
      Mr. Bosley moved for third reading and        
final passage of Board Bill No. 290.                
     Seconded by Ms. Ford-Griffin.                  
     Carried by the following vote:                 
     Ayes: Troupe, Flowers, Bosley, Moore,          
Griffin, Young, Ortmann, Vollmer, Villa,            
Wessels, Florida, Baringer, Roddy, Kennedy,         
Schmid, Jones-King, Boyd, Hanrahan,                 
Waterhouse, Kirner, Williamson, Carter and          
Krewson. 23                                         
     Noes: 0                                        
      Abstention: 1 - President Reed                
abstained to avoid the appearance of a conflict     
of interest.                                        
      Mr. Bosley moved for third reading and        
final passage of Board Bill No. 291.                
     Seconded by Ms. Ford-Griffin.                  
     Carried by the following vote:                 
     Ayes: Troupe, Flowers, Bosley, Moore,          
Griffin, Young, Ortmann, Vollmer, Villa,            
Wessels, Florida, Baringer, Roddy, Kennedy,         
Schmid, Jones-King, Boyd, Hanrahan,                 
Waterhouse, Kirner, Williamson, Carter and          
Krewson. 23                                         
     Noes: 0                                        
      Abstention: 1 - President Reed abstained      
to avoid the appearance of a conflict of interest.  
     Ms. Hanrahan moved to suspend the              
rules to permit the third reading and final         
passage of Board Bills No. 326, 380, 381 and        
426.                                                
     Seconded by Mr. Villa.                         
     Carried by the following vote:                 
      Ayes: Troupe, Flowers, Bosley, Moore,         
Griffin, Young, Conway, Ortmann, Vollmer,           
Villa, Wessels, Florida, Baringer, Roddy,           
Kennedy, Schmid, Jones-King, Boyd,                  
Hanrahan, Waterhouse, Kirner, Williamson,           
Carter, Krewson and President Reed. 25              
     Noes: 0                                        
           Board Bill No. 326                       
     An Ordinance authorizing and directing         
the City Counselor on behalf of the City of         
St. Louis, to enter into and execute a Grant        
Agreement with the Office of the Secretary of       
State for a grant to fund a Local Records           
Preservation Project for the City Counselor's       
 Office, appropriating said funds in the amount   
 of $5,000.00 and authorizing the City            
 Counselor on behalf of the City, upon            
 approval of the Board of Estimate and            
 Apportionment, to expend the funds by            
 entering into contracts or otherwise for grant   
 purposes and containing an emergency clause.     
            Board Bill No. 380                    
      An Ordinance directing the Director of      
 Streets to temporarily close, barricade, or      
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic from the    
 southeast corner to the northeast corner on      
 Garfield just east of Annie Malone Drive.        
            Board Bill No. 381                    
      An Ordinance directing the Director of      
 Streets to temporarily close, barricade, or      
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic from the    
 southwest corner to the northwest corner on      
 N. Market just west of Whittier Street.          
            Board Bill No. 426                    
       An Ordinance directing the Director of     
 Streets to temporarily close, barricade, or      
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic on north    
 Market Street at the east curb line of Marcus    
 Avenue; on Dick Gregory Place at the north       
 curb line of Dr. Martin Luther King Drive;       
 remove, redirect and establish the direction of  
 Aldine Avenue as a one way street from           
 eastbound to westbound; remove, redirect and     
 establish the direction of Leduc as a one way    
 street from eastbound to westbound; remove,      
 redirect and establish the direction of Cote     
 Brilliante Avenue as a one way street from       
 eastbound to westbound, and containing an        
 emergency clause.                                
   THIRD READING, REPORT OF                       
 THE ENGROSSMENT COMMITTEE                        
      AND FINAL PASSAGE                           
        OF BOARD BILLS                            
     Board of Aldermen, St. Louis Committee       
 Report, January 11, 2008.                        
      To the President of the Board of            
 Aldermen:                                        
      The Committee on Engrossed and              
 Enrolled Bills to whom was referred the          
 following Board Bills report that they have      
 considered the same, and they are truly          
 engrossed.                                       
            Board Bill No. 288                    
      An ordinance authorizing and directing      
 the Director of Streets to close, barricade or   
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic on E.       
 Obear Street by blocking said traffic flow at    
 the south line of Blair at E. Obear and          
 containing an emergency clause.                  
            Board Bill No. 289                    
      An ordinance authorizing and directing      
 the Director of Streets to close, barricade or   
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic on Obear  
 Street by blocking said traffic flow at the    
 north line of Emily at Obear and containing an 
 emergency clause.                              
            Board Bill No. 290                  
      An ordinance authorizing and directing    
 the Director of Streets to close, barricade or 
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic on John   
 Street by blocking said traffic flow at the    
 south line of Blair at John and containing an  
 emergency clause.                              
            Board Bill No. 291                  
      An ordinance authorizing and directing    
 the Director of Streets to close, barricade or 
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic on John   
 Street by blocking said traffic flow at the    
 north line of Emily at John and containing an  
 emergency clause.                              
            Board Bill No. 326                  
      An Ordinance authorizing and directing    
 the City Counselor on behalf of the City of    
 St. Louis, to enter into and execute a Grant   
 Agreement with the Office of the Secretary of  
 State for a grant to fund a Local Records      
 Preservation Project for the City Counselor's  
 Office, appropriating said funds in the amount 
 of $5,000.00 and authorizing the City          
 Counselor on behalf of the City, upon          
 approval of the Board of Estimate and          
 Apportionment, to expend the funds by          
 entering into contracts or otherwise for grant 
 purposes and containing an emergency clause.   
            Board Bill No. 380                  
      An Ordinance directing the Director of    
 Streets to temporarily close, barricade, or    
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic from the  
 southeast corner to the northeast corner on    
 Garfield just east of Annie Malone Drive.      
            Board Bill No. 381                  
      An Ordinance directing the Director of    
 Streets to temporarily close, barricade, or    
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic from the  
 southwest corner to the northwest corner on    
 N. Market just west of Whittier Street.        
            Board Bill No. 426                  
       An Ordinance directing the Director of   
 Streets to temporarily close, barricade, or    
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic on north  
 Market Street at the east curb line of Marcus  
 Avenue; on Dick Gregory Place at the north     
 curb line of Dr. Martin Luther King Drive;     
 remove, redirect and establish the direction of
 Aldine Avenue as a one way street from         
 eastbound to westbound; remove, redirect and   
 establish the direction of Leduc as a one way  
 street from eastbound to westbound; remove,    
 redirect and establish the direction of Cote   
 Brilliante Avenue as a one way street from     
 eastbound to westbound, and containing an      
 emergency clause.                              
     Alderman Ortmann                           
     Chairman of the Committee                  
        REPORT OF THE                           
    ENROLLMENT COMMITTEE                        
    Board of Aldermen, St. Louis Committee      
Report, January 11, 2008.                       
     To the President of the Board of           
Aldermen:                                       
      The Committee on Engrossed and            
Enrolled Bills to whom was referred the         
following Board Bills report that they have     
considered the same, and they are truly         
enrolled.                                       
          Board Bill No. 288                    
     An ordinance authorizing and directing     
the Director of Streets to close, barricade or  
otherwise impede the flow of traffic on E.      
Obear Street by blocking said traffic flow at   
the south line of Blair at E. Obear and         
containing an emergency clause.                 
          Board Bill No. 289                    
     An ordinance authorizing and directing     
the Director of Streets to close, barricade or  
otherwise impede the flow of traffic on Obear   
Street by blocking said traffic flow at the     
north line of Emily at Obear and containing an  
emergency clause.                               
          Board Bill No. 290                    
     An ordinance authorizing and directing     
the Director of Streets to close, barricade or  
otherwise impede the flow of traffic on John    
Street by blocking said traffic flow at the     
south line of Blair at John and containing an   
emergency clause.                               
          Board Bill No. 291                    
     An ordinance authorizing and directing     
the Director of Streets to close, barricade or  
otherwise impede the flow of traffic on John    
Street by blocking said traffic flow at the     
north line of Emily at John and containing an   
emergency clause.                               
          Board Bill No. 326                    
     An Ordinance authorizing and directing     
the City Counselor on behalf of the City of     
St. Louis, to enter into and execute a Grant    
Agreement with the Office of the Secretary of   
State for a grant to fund a Local Records       
Preservation Project for the City Counselor's   
Office, appropriating said funds in the amount  
of $5,000.00 and authorizing the City           
Counselor on behalf of the City, upon           
approval of the Board of Estimate and           
Apportionment, to expend the funds by           
entering into contracts or otherwise for grant  
purposes and containing an emergency clause.    
          Board Bill No. 380                    
     An Ordinance directing the Director of     
Streets to temporarily close, barricade, or     
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic from the     
 southeast corner to the northeast corner on       
 Garfield just east of Annie Malone Drive.         
            Board Bill No. 381                     
      An Ordinance directing the Director of       
 Streets to temporarily close, barricade, or       
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic from the     
 southwest corner to the northwest corner on       
 N. Market just west of Whittier Street.           
            Board Bill No. 426                     
       An Ordinance directing the Director of      
 Streets to temporarily close, barricade, or       
 otherwise impede the flow of traffic on north     
 Market Street at the east curb line of Marcus     
 Avenue; on Dick Gregory Place at the north        
 curb line of Dr. Martin Luther King Drive;        
 remove, redirect and establish the direction of   
 Aldine Avenue as a one way street from            
 eastbound to westbound; remove, redirect and      
 establish the direction of Leduc as a one way     
 street from eastbound to westbound; remove,       
 redirect and establish the direction of Cote      
 Brilliante Avenue as a one way street from        
 eastbound to westbound, and containing an         
 emergency clause.                                 
      Alderman Ortmann                             
      Chairman of the Committee                    
      Board Bills Numbered Board Bills             
 Numbered 288, 289, 290, 291, 326, 380, 381        
 and 426 were read and all other business being    
 suspended, Mr. Reed, in the presence of the       
 Board and in open session, affixed his signature  
 in accordance with the provisions of the          
 Charter.                                          
      COURTESY RESOLUTIONS                         
        CONSENT CALENDAR                           
       President Reed introduced Resolutions       
 No. 298 - 304, 306 - 309, 311 and 312 and the     
 clerk was instructed to read same.                
           Resolution No. 298                      
            CHARLES W. TYLER                       
      WHEREAS, we pause in our                     
 deliberations to note the untimely passing of     
 Charles W. Tyler on Tuesday, December 18,         
 2007;and                                          
      WHEREAS, Charles W. Tyler, was a             
 resident and a proud citizen of the City of St.   
 Louis who devoted his career to serving the       
 St. Louis metropolitan area; and                  
       WHEREAS, Charles W. Tyler served            
 the St. Louis metropolitan area through his       
 work with the Work Force Partners of Metro        
 St. Louis, Grand Rock Community Economic          
 Development Corporation, Adams Mark               
 Community Center, Inc., Beyond Housing,           
 and St. Louis County, Department of               
 Planning; and                                     
      WHEREAS, Charles W. Tyler belonged           
 to many professional and civic organizations:    
 Member, Leadership of St. Louis, Class of        
 1999/2000; Member, Governor 's Lead              
 Advisory Board; Member, The Work Force           
 Alliance; volunteer, Fair St. Louis; volunteer,  
 St. Louis Jazz Festival; and stakeholder,        
 Advance St. Louis; and                           
        WHEREAS, Mr. Tyler being a loving         
 husband and father, good neighbor and friend     
 to all, will be missed.                          
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis, that, on behalf of the St.
 Louis metropolitan community we pause to         
 remember the many contributions of Charles       
 W. Tyler to the citizens of the City of St.      
 Louis and the region, and we join his family     
 and many friends in expressing our sorrow at     
 his passing, and we further direct the clerk of  
 this board to spread a copy of this resolution   
 across the minutes of the proceedings and to     
 prepare a memorial copy for presentation to      
 the family, at a time and place deemed           
 appropriate by the sponsor.                      
 Introduced on the 11th day of January, 2008      
 by:                                              
 Honorable Freeman Bosley, Sr.,Alderman 3rd       
            Resolution No. 299                    
             ROGER DUNCAN                         
      WHEREAS, we pause in our                    
 deliberations to note the untimely passing of    
 Roger Duncan on Sunday, December 16, 2007;       
 and                                              
     WHEREAS, Roger Duncan served as a            
 community activist in the City of St. Louis;     
 and                                              
      WHEREAS, Roger served as secretary          
 for Congregations Allied for Community           
 Improvement (CACI), which is part of             
 Metropolitan Congregations United (MCU);         
 and                                              
       WHEREAS, Roger organized and was a         
 leader of Union Communion Core Team for          
 three congregations: Union Avenue Christian      
 Church, Pilgrim Congregational United Church     
 of Christ, and Westminster Presbyterian          
 Church, led to establishment of Union            
 Communion Holy Ground; and                       
       WHEREAS, Roger helped with the             
 rebirth of the Enright Block Unit; and           
      WHEREAS, Roger led the CACI task            
 force for North City Redevelopment; and          
      WHEREAS, Roger was behind the               
 development of the current CACI Community        
 Resource Book; and                               
       WHEREAS, Roger was an integral part        
 of the Ivory Perry Park Concerts, serving as     
planner, grant writer, committee member, and      
musician liaison; and                             
    WHEREAS, Roger as a lover of Blues            
music, was the founder of a Blues Service at      
Union Avenue Christian Church; and                
      WHEREAS, Roger served on the                
Religious Coalition for Reproductive Choice,      
as a board member, and lobbyist; and              
      WHEREAS, Omaha, Nebraska was the            
start of Roger's community involvement            
including directing Whitman Center Runaway        
House, and promoting national legislation for     
runaway youth; and                                
      WHEREAS, with an interest in the            
environment, organic farming, and a "simple       
life" led Roger to found the Prairie Sunset       
Food Co-op, where he served as resident agent;    
and                                               
      WHEREAS, planning for the Southeast         
Nebraska Community Action Center was              
additional work he accomplished in Nebraska;      
and                                               
      WHEREAS, Mr. Duncan being a loving          
husband, father, good neighbor and friend to      
all, will be missed.                              
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
deliberations to remember the many                
contributions of Roger Duncan to the citizens     
of the City St. Louis and the region, and we      
join his family and many friends in expressing    
our sorrow at his passing; and we further direct  
the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy of       
this Resolution across the minutes of these       
proceedings and to prepare a commemorative        
copy to the end that it may be presented to       
our honoree at a time and place deemed            
appropriate by the Sponsor.                       
Introduced on the 11th day of January, 2008       
by:                                               
Honorable Frank Williamson,Alderman 26th Ward     
          Resolution No. 300                      
          JOHNNIE L. TRIPLETT                     
     WHEREAS, we pause in our                     
deliberations to note the untimely passing of     
Johnnie L. Triplett, beloved father of            
Alderwoman Kacie Starr Triplett, on Tuesday,      
December 18, 2007; and                            
     WHEREAS, on August 18, 1952,                 
Johnnie L. Triplett, affectionately known as      
"Big John," was born in Macon, Mississippi        
to the union of John and Lena Triplett, the       
eldest of five children; and                      
     WHEREAS, Johnnie L. Triplett                 
accepted Christ at an early age and attended      
St. Louis Public Schools and St. Louis            
 Community College at Forest Park. He was a         
 member of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity; and          
      WHEREAS, after a brief career in the          
 U.S. Military, he was honorably discharged.        
 He then completed an apprenticeship program        
 with Bricklayers Local 1 and later joined the      
 brotherhood of Plumbers & Pipefitters Local        
 562. He served as a Pipefitter and union           
 organizer with Local 562 for over 29 years,        
 organizing non-union shops and fighting for        
 quality jobs and wages. He worked for              
 inclusion within the union membership; and         
      WHEREAS, as a member of the                   
 Coalition of Black Trade Unionists, he worked      
 with other union members to create an              
 organization called Men Who Care, which            
 raised money for charity; and                      
      WHEREAS, on October 18, 1975,                 
 Johnnie and Jill Bass were united in holy          
 matrimony. Two children were born to this          
 union, Kacie Starr Triplett and Travis John        
 Triplett (Jeralynn).                               
      WHEREAS, he leaves to cherish his             
 memory his loving parents, John and Lena           
 Triplett; four sisters, Rebecca McClure,           
 Jennifer Whitfield (Scott), Tracy Triplett and     
 Brenda Triplett, who preceded him in death;        
 a granddaughter, Christiana; an expected           
 grandson due January, 2008; a special friend,      
 Ms. Diane Johnson; and a host of friends and       
 other relatives.                                   
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of               
 the City of St. Louis, that, on behalf of the St.  
 Louis metropolitan community we pause to           
 remember the many contributions of Johnnie         
 L. Triplett to the citizens of the City of St.     
 Louis and the region, and we join his family       
 and many friends in expressing our sorrow at       
 his passing, and we further direct the clerk of    
 this board to spread a copy of this resolution     
 across the minutes of the proceedings and to       
 prepare a memorial copy for presentation to        
 the family, at a time and place deemed             
 appropriate by the sponsor.                        
 Introduced on the 11th day of January, 2008        
 by:                                                
 Hon. Bennice Jones-King, 21st Ward                 
 Hon. Samuel L. Moore, 4th Ward                     
 Hon. Charles Q. Troupe, 1st Ward                   
 Hon. Dionne Flowers, 2nd Ward                      
 Hon. Freeman Bosley, Sr., 3rd Ward                 
 Hon.April Ford Griffin, 5th Ward                   
 Hon. Kacie StarrTriplett, 6th Ward                 
 Hon. Phyllis Young, 7th Ward                       
 Hon. Stephen Conway, 8thWard                       
 Hon. Kenneth Ortmann, 9thWard                      
 Hon. Joseph Vollmer, 10th Ward                     
 Hon. Matt Villa, 11th Ward                         
 Hon. Fred Heitert, 12th Ward                       
 Hon.Alfred Wessels, Jr., 13th Ward             
 Hon. Stephen Gregali, 14th Ward                
 Hon. Jennifer Florida, 15th Ward               
 Hon. Donna Baringer, 16th Ward                 
 Hon. Joseph Roddy, 17th Ward                   
 Hon.Terry Kennedy, 18thWard                    
 Hon. Marlene Davis, 19th Ward                  
 Hon. Craig Schmid, 20th Ward                   
 Hon. Jeffrey Boyd, 22nd Ward                   
 Hon. Kathleen Hanrahan, 23rdWard               
 Hon. William Waterhouse, 24th Ward             
 Hon. Dorothy Kirner, 25th Ward                 
 Hon. Frank Williamson, 26th Ward               
 Hon. Gregory Carter, 27th Ward                 
 Hon. Lyda Krewson, 28thWard                    
 Hon. Lewis E. Reed, President                  
           Resolution No. 301                   
       MARSHA CHRISTINE NASH                    
      WHEREAS, we pause in our                  
 deliberations to note the untimely passing of  
 Marsha Christine Nash on Friday, December      
 14, 2007; and                                  
      WHEREAS, Marsha Christine Nash            
 was born November 27, 1960 to James and        
 Joy Williams. Her father preceded her in       
 death; and                                     
      WHEREAS, Marsha graduated from            
 Rosati-Kain High School in 1978. She received  
 her Bachelor of Arts degree from the           
 University of Missouri-Columbia; and           
       WHEREAS, Marsha's greatest joy was       
 the birth of her daughter, Erin Mallory Jordan,
 from her first marriage to Arthur D. Jordan.   
 She loved and nurtured her and watched her     
 develop into the fine young woman she has      
 become; and                                    
       WHEREAS, Marsha set very high work       
 ethics and standards for herself. One of her   
 concerns was to better her community. She      
 sat on many boards and committees; and         
      WHEREAS, her biggest accomplish-          
 ment were as Program Coordinator at the        
 Missouri Historical Society. She implemented   
 the "African American History Series" in       
 which she sought world renowned speakers;      
 and                                            
      WHEREAS, Marsh found love and             
 married Mr. O'Rey Nash Jr., of Cleveland,      
 Ohio on April 20, 2007. Marsha loved her       
 family very much and was proud of their many   
 accomplishments; and                           
      WHEREAS, God called her home on           
 Friday, December 14, 2007. She leaves to       
 celebrate her memory: her loving husband -     
 O'Rey, her beautiful daughter - Erin, mother - 
 Joy Williams, sister - Mary Ann, brother -     
 Michael, grandmother - Bertha Oliver, aunt -   
 Pat Williams, three uncles - Albert, Carl, and 
 Roderick Williams, two nephews - Brandon       
and Michael Williams, niece - Jadyn Victoria       
Williams, and a host of other aunts, uncles,       
cousins and friends. A special thanks to a         
person Marsha loved and held a special bond        
with - Mrs. Yvonne Matthews.                       
     NOW THEREFORE BE IT                           
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of               
the City of St. Louis, that, on behalf of the St.  
Louis community, we pause to remember              
Marsha Christine Nash, and we join with her        
family and many friends in expressing our          
sorrow at her passing, and we further direct       
the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy of        
this Resolution across the minutes of these        
proceedings and to prepare a memorial copy         
for presentation to the family, at a time and      
place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.           
Introduced on the 11th day of January, 2008        
HonorableBenniceJones-King,Alderwoman21stWard      
           Resolution No. 302                      
        MATTHEW B. MCMAHON                         
     WHEREAS, we have been apprised that           
on December 29, 2007 the rank of Eagle Scout       
will be awarded to Matthew B. McMahon,             
who lives with his family at 946 Stone Spring      
Drive; and                                         
       WHEREAS, Matthew is the son of              
Brett and Diana McMahon, who are both              
proud and happy to announce this                   
momentous accomplishment in Matthew's              
life; and                                          
     WHEREAS, Matthew has dedicated                
himself to the hard work and commitment of         
the Scouting program without forgetting the        
importance of his education; and                   
      WHEREAS, those who are familiar with         
Scouting are aware that the rank of Eagle Scout    
is a goal sought by many but attained by few;      
requiring intelligence, perseverance, and a        
strong sense of service to your community;         
and                                                
      WHEREAS, Matthew is a role model             
for all of the younger scouts in Troop 4 and       
will be honored by them, along with his family     
and many friends, at the Eagle Scout Court of      
Honor to be held on December 29, 2007.             
     NOW THEREFORE BE IT                           
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of               
the City of St. Louis, that we pause in our        
deliberations to recognize Matthew B.              
McMahon for the significant honor to be            
bestowed upon him at the Eagle Court of            
Honor. We congratulate and extend our best         
wishes to Matthew and his family, and we           
further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread   
a copy of this Resolution across the minutes       
of these proceedings and to prepare a              
commemorative copy to the end that it may          
be presented to our honoree at a time and          
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.         
 Introduced this 11th day of January, 2008        
 by:                                              
 Honorable Donna Baringer,Alderwoman 16th Ward    
           Resolution No. 303                     
            DANIEL J. KROEGER                     
       WHEREAS, we have been apprised that        
 on December 29, 2007 the rank of Eagle Scout     
 will be awarded to Daniel J. Kroeger, who        
 lives with his family at 5847 Delor Street; and  
      WHEREAS, Daniel is the son of Russ          
 and Martha Kroeger, who are both proud and       
 happy to announce this momentous                 
 accomplishment in Daniel's life; and             
      WHEREAS, Daniel has dedicated               
 himself to the hard work and commitment of       
 the Scouting program without forgetting the      
 importance of his education; and                 
       WHEREAS, those who are familiar with       
 Scouting are aware that the rank of Eagle Scout  
 is a goal sought by many but attained by few;    
 requiring intelligence, perseverance, and a      
 strong sense of service to your community;       
 and                                              
       WHEREAS, Daniel is a role model for        
 all of the younger scouts in Troop 4 and will    
 be honored by them, along with his family        
 and many friends, at the Eagle Scout Court of    
 Honor to be held on December 29, 2007.           
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis, that we pause in our      
 deliberations to recognize Daniel J. Kroeger     
 for the significant honor to be bestowed upon    
 him at the Eagle Court of Honor. We              
 congratulate and extend our best wishes to       
 Daniel and his family, and we further direct     
 the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy of      
 this Resolution across the minutes of these      
 proceedings and to prepare a commemorative       
 copy to the end that it may be presented to      
 our honoree at a time and place deemed           
 appropriate by the Sponsor.

 by:

           Resolution No. 304                     
              KEVIN T. WIESE                      
       WHEREAS, we have been apprised that        
 on December 29, 2007 the rank of Eagle Scout     
 will be awarded to Kevin T. Wiese, who lives     
 with his family at 6478 Murdoch Avenue; and      
      WHEREAS, Kevin is the son of Tim            
 and Lynne Wiese, who are both proud and          
 happy to announce this momentous                 
 accomplishment in Kevin's life; and              
      WHEREAS, Kevin has dedicated              
 himself to the hard work and commitment of     
 the Scouting program without forgetting the    
 importance of his education; and               
       WHEREAS, those who are familiar with     
 Scouting are aware that the rank of Eagle Scout
 is a goal sought by many but attained by few;  
 requiring intelligence, perseverance, and a    
 strong sense of service to your community;     
 and                                            
       WHEREAS, Kevin is a role model for       
 all of the younger scouts in Troop 4 and will  
 be honored by them, along with his family      
 and many friends, at the Eagle Scout Court of  
 Honor to be held on December 29, 2007.         
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT

 congratulate and extend our best wishes to     
 Kevin and his family, and we further direct

 this Resolution across the minutes of these    
 proceedings and to prepare a commemorative     
 copy to the end that it may be presented to    
 our honoree at a time and place deemed         
 appropriate by the Sponsor.                    
 Introduced this 11th day of January, 2008      
 by:                                            
 Honorable Donna Baringer,Alderwoman 16th Ward  
           Resolution No. 306                   
           JERRY HAROLD REID                    
       WHEREAS, we pause in our                 
 deliberations to note the untimely passing of  
 Jerry Harold Reid, on Wednesday, December      
 26, 2007; and                                  
       WHEREAS, on December 4, 1946, Jerry      
 Harold Reid, was born in St. Louis, Missouri   
 to the union of Chester and Jane Reid. He      
 was the eighth child of twelve children. His   
 father, mother, and brothers, Chester, Jr.,    
 Anthony and Michael all preceded him in        
 death; and                                     
      WHEREAS, Jerry Harold Reid was            
 educated in the St. Louis Public Schools. He   
 also attended Mesa Community College in        
 Grand Jackson, Colorado and was a graduate     
 of Weber State University in Odgen, Utah       
 where he earned a degree in social work; and   
      WHEREAS, Jerry fell in love and was       
 united in Holy Matrimony with Beverly          
 Graham. They were blessed with three           
 children, Richard, Kimberly and Malek, who     
 he loved and cherished dearly. Malek also      
 preceded him in death; and                     
      WHEREAS, Jerry was a music lover and      
played for various occasions. He traveled to       
Memphis, Bosnia, Saudi Arabia and the              
Caribbean among other places. After his stay       
in Memphis, he returned and worked with a          
number of choirs here in the City. He also         
played with several well-known bands; and          
     WHEREAS, at the time he became ill,           
he had joined the Tyler Place Presbyterian         
Church under the leadership of Reverend Bob        
Hagel, Pastor. He was an elder for a year and      
a member for five years; and                       
     WHEREAS, Jerry worked for various             
agencies in Human Services and also worked         
as a substitute teacher. At his departure he       
was employed with A.A.R.P.; and                    
      WHEREAS, Jerry's attributes included         
his smile and humor, which made it impossible      
for him to meet a stranger. He loved to sing,      
write music and perform. Whenever he was           
asked to perform, he would always say yes.         
      WHEREAS, Jerry will always be                
cherished by his loving family: children,          
Richard Frye and Kimberly Tapp; brothers,          
Ivory (Martha), Charles, Donnell, Melvin           
(Geraldine), Andrew (Cheryl) and Aaron;            
sisters, Ola (Earl) and Cynthia; four              
grandchildren; a multitude of nieces, nephews,     
great nieces, great nephews, cousins, friends      
and loved ones; a very special friend, Mary        
Connors.                                           
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of               
the City of St. Louis, that, on behalf of the St.  
Louis metropolitan community we pause to           
remember the many contributions of Jerry           
Harold Reid to the citizens of the City of St.     
Louis, the region, and the world because of        
his music; and we join his family and many         
friends in expressing our sorrow at his passing.   
We further direct the clerk of this board to       
spread a copy of this resolution across the        
minutes of the proceedings and to prepare a        
memorial copy for presentation to the family,      
at a time and place deemed appropriate by          
the sponsor.                                       
Introduced on the 11th day of January, 2008        
by:                                                
Honorable Freeman Bosley, Sr..Alderman 3rd Ward    
           Resolution No. 307                      
           GEORGIA B. SLOAN                        
     WHEREAS, we pause in our                      
deliberations to note the untimely passing of      
Georgia B. Sloan on January 1, 2008; and           
     WHEREAS, Georgia B. Sloan was born            
on September 5, 1919 in Elsberry, Missouri         
to Frank and Gertrude West Boone. She was          
the second born of six girls. AdeII, Esther,       
Mary, and her older brother William Boone          
preceded her in death; and                         
       WHEREAS, Georgia was a remarkable              
 woman. When the opportunity came to get a            
 job with the City of St. Louis, Georgia took         
 it. She was employed by the City of St. Louis        
 for 32 years in the Communications                   
 Department as a Telephone Operations                 
 Supervisor. She worked 30 years at Koch              
 Hospital and 2 years at St. Louis City               
 Hospital No. 1. Georgia was the last employee        
 to leave City Hospital before the doors were         
 closed for the final time. Ironically, the building  
 is now called "The Georgian"; and                    
       WHEREAS, Georgia was a member of               
 old St. Bridget's Church before its closing.         
 She was a faithful member until her health           
 failed, and she was unable to attend. She            
 volunteered at the church where needed and           
 was a member of the Daughters of St. Peter           
 Clever; and                                          
      WHEREAS, Georgia graduated from                 
 Vashon High School and was one of the                
 "Vashon 39ers." She loved to travel and cruised      
 regularly with her club, "The Fun Folks" and         
 anyone else who invited her to go; and               
       WHEREAS, Georgia and her husband,              
 the late Samuel Thurman Sloan, owned Sloan's         
 Confectionery on Franklin Avenue in St. Louis        
 for many years. She was also a licensed              
 beautician. Georgia volunteered at St. Louis         
 Regional Medical Center after her retirement.        
 There she met Paula Claxton and took her on          
 as another daughter, along with her family;          
 and                                                  
      WHEREAS, Georgia leaves to mourn                
 her passing daughters Mary Michelle Bell,            
 Marilyn Kaye Sloan, and Paula Claxton;               
 Stepdaughter Dana Carver; Sisters Violet             
 Hancock and Camilla Thomas; Brother-in-law           
 Ramiro Diaz; Special granddaughter Torian            
 Zinn; Eighteen grandchildren, many great-            
 grandchildren, and a host of other relatives,        
 friends and loved ones; and a special friend         
 and caregiver, Mr. Milton Jordan; also Mr.           
 Simon Carver; and friends and neighbors in           
 the 4100 Block of Maffitt Avenue, St. Louis,         
 Missouri.                                            
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                            
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                 
 the City of St. Louis, that, on behalf of the St.    
 Louis Community, we pause to remember                
 Georgia B. Sloan, and we join with her family        
 and many friends in expressing our sorrow at         
 her passing, and we further direct the Clerk of      
 this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution       
 across the minutes of these proceedings and          
 to prepare a memorial copy for presentation          
 to the family, at a time and place deemed            
 appropriate by the Sponsor.                          
 Introduced on the 11th day of January, 2008          
 by:                                                  
 Honorable Samuel L. Moore,Alderman 4th Ward      
            Resolution No. 308                    
            WILLIE MAE LONG                       
      WHEREAS, we pause in our                    
 deliberations to honor Willie Mae Long on        
 the occasion of her 100th birthday; and          
      WHEREAS, Willie Mae was born in             
 Clarendon, Arkansas to Emma and Will Rucker      
 on January 21, 1908; and                         
      WHEREAS, Willie Mae moved to Saint          
 Louis at age 10 and attended St. Louis Public    
 Schools; and                                     
      WHEREAS, Willie Mae married                 
 Theodore Roosevelt Long on August 1, 1929        
 and remained married for 49 years until his      
 demise on November 29, 1978; and                 
       WHEREAS, to this Holy Union five           
 children were born: Ernize, Jean, Theodore       
 Jr., LaRoye and Reginald; and                    
      WHEREAS, Willie Mae has eleven              
 grandchildren and six great grandchildren; and   
      WHEREAS, Willie Mae has been an             
 active member of St. James A.M.E. Church         
 for over sixty years, has been recognized as     
 Mother of the Year, remains a member of the      
 Seasoned Saints and is currently a life member   
 of the Missionary Society and Altar Guild;       
 and                                              
      WHEREAS, Willie Mae was actively            
 involved in the community with the Federation    
 of Block Units and the National Council of       
 Negro Women; and                                 
      WHEREAS, Willie Mae was a full time         
 homemaker and enjoys her family, home,           
 baking and gardening.                            
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our       
 deliberations to honor and recognize Willie      
 Mae Long on the occasion of her 100th            
 birthday, and we join her family and many        
 friends in wishing her continued peace and       
 happiness. We direct the Clerk of the Board      
 to spread a copy of this Resolution across the   
 minutes of these proceedings and to further      
 prepare a commemorative copy to the end          
 that it may be presented to our honoree at a     
 time and place deemed appropriate by the         
 Sponsor.                                         
 Introduced on the 11th day of January, 2008      
 by:                                              
 Honorable Joseph Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward        
            Resolution No. 309                    
             ELVIRA L. MILLER                     
      WHEREAS, we have been apprised that         
 Elvira L. Miller will be retiring from the United
States Postal Service on January 11, 2008,        
with 35 years of service; and                     
      WHEREAS, Ms. Miller began her Civil         
Service career in 1974 at the entry level of the  
Civil Service Employment and is retiring from     
the position of USP Service Manager for The       
St. Louis Accounting Service Center,              
Accounting Control Operations; and                
      WHEREAS, Ms. Miller has held several        
positions during her career. She started out      
as a Mailhandler; continued as an Audit Code      
and Correlation Clerk; Claims & Voucher Exam      
Tech; Accounting Spec Sr.; Accountant;            
Supervisor, Air Transportation; Sr. Systems       
Accountant as well as worked for the              
Department of Army and the Department of          
Agriculture; and                                  
      WHEREAS, Ms. Miller has done an             
outstanding job at every level. She has worked    
long and hard and has maintained an impeccable    
reputation of the highest standards; and          
      WHEREAS, Ms. Miller manages 66              
employees, ranging from entry level to career     
positions. She maintains an open door policy      
to all of her employees. She listens and          
advises, and no issue is too small or too         
complex; and                                      
     WHEREAS, Ms. Miller has been a               
mentor, as well as friend, to many employees.     
She has trained hundreds of Postal employees.     
She has served on several Promotion Boards,       
making the appropriate decision to not only       
promote qualified and well-trained employees,     
but also to have a hand in their career           
advancement.                                      
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
deliberations to recognize Ms. Elvira L.          
Miller's dedication and commitment to the         
citizens of the City of St. Louis, and we direct  
the Clerk of this Board to prepare a              
commemorative copy of this Resolution to          
the end that it may be presented to our honoree   
at a time and place deemed appropriate by         
the sponsor.                                      
Introduced on this 11th day of January, 2008      
by:                                               
Honorable Freeman Bosley, Sr.,Alderman 3rd Ward   
           Resolution No. 311                     
          BRIAN KETCHERSIDE                       
      WHEREAS, Brian Ketcherside came             
to the City of St. Louis as an employee with      
experience in security, having worked as a        
security officer at McDonnell Douglas (later      
Boeing); and                                      
     WHEREAS, Brian Ketcherside recently          
celebrated his tenth anniversary as a public      
 servant of the City of St. Louis, having been     
 hired in October,1997 as a security officer       
 and then serving as a deputy marshal; and         
       WHEREAS, Brian Ketcherside was              
 promoted to the Building Division of the City     
 of St. Louis on September 11, 2000, to provide    
 service to residents, property owners, and        
 business proprietors by maintaining the high      
 professional standards of the Building            
 Division within the Department of Public          
 Safety of the City of St. Louis; and              
      WHEREAS, Brian Ketcherside has               
 embraced and encouraged redevelopment             
 wherever he has been a building inspector,        
 including during his last assignment to the       
 Twentieth (20th) Ward, working the Gravois        
 Park, Benton Park West and Cherokee Street        
 areas; and                                        
       WHEREAS, Brian Ketcherside has been         
 reassigned to the Ninth (9th) Ward, continuing    
 his work down the street in the same              
 neighborhoods and Cherokee Street area.           
        NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED that we pause in our                     
 deliberations to thank Brian Ketcherside for      
 his years of service to the residents, property   
 owners and business proprietors of the City       
 of St. Louis. We wish him well as he continues    
 his work around the Cherokee Street area in a     
 new ward. We further direct the Clerk of this     
 Board to spread a copy of this Resolution         
 across the Minutes of these proceedings and       
 to prepare a commemorative copy for               
 presentation to our honoree at a time and place   
 deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.                
 Introduced on this 11th day of January, 2008      
 by:                                               
 Honorable Craig Schmid,Alderman 20th Ward         
           Resolution No. 312                      
      M. MIKE ALIZADEH, P.E.,S.E.                  
     WHEREAS, we have been apprised that           
 M. Mike Alizadeh, P.E.,S.E., structural and       
 geotechnical engineer and founder of              
 Geotechnology passed away in his sleep on         
 August 25, 2007; and                              
       WHEREAS, Mr. Alizadeh earned his            
 B.S. in civil engineering at the University of    
 Tehran in 1958 and his M.S. in civil engineering  
 at the University of Michigan in 1959; and        
      WHEREAS, Mr. Alizadeh accepted a             
 job with Fruin Colnon, a general contractor,      
 based in St. Louis in 1959. He remained with      
 the company for ten years; and                    
      WHEREAS, Mr. Alizadeh went to work           
 with McLelland Engineers (now Fugro) in           
 1969. He was hired by Shannon & Wilson (S         
 & W) to start its office in St. Louis. He         
 remained with S & W for eight years. His          
 years with McLelland and S & W were really       
 the prime of his technical career. He worked     
 on many major St. Louis area projects including  
 the Pierre Laclede Building and the Rush Island  
 Power Plant and the original Busch Stadium;      
        WHEREAS, in 1984, Mr. Alizadeh            
 founded Geotechnology, Inc. The employees        
 of the company continues to represent Mr.        
 Alizadeh in a way he would be proud.             
 Geotechnology's core values of                   
 responsiveness, quality, integrity, partnership  
 and opportunity are the values that Mr.          
 Alizadeh instilled in all of the employees; and  
      WHEREAS, The Mike Alizadeh                  
 Graduate Studies Scholarship was established     
 with the St. Louis section of the American       
 Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE). The           
 scholarship will be awarded annually to one      
 or two individual's pursuing a graduate degree   
 with a preference for students intending to      
 practice as consulting engineers in the          
 Midwest; and                                     
       WHEREAS, Mr. Alizadeh will be              
 greatly missed by his wife of 49 years, Pouran   
 and three children.                              
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis, that, on behalf of the St.
 Louis community, we pause to remember the        
 many contributions of M. Mike Alizadeh to        
 the citizens of the City of St. Louis, and we    
 join with his family and many friends in         
 expressing our sorrow at his passing, and we     
 further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread 
 a copy of this Resolution across the minutes     
 of these proceedings and to prepare a memorial   
 copy for presentation to the family, at a time   
 and place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.     
 Introduced on the 11th day of January, 2008      
 by:                                              
 Honorable Marlene Davis,Alderwoman 19th Ward     
      Unanimous consent having been               
 obtained, Resolutions No. 298 - 304, 306 -       
 309, 311 and 312 stood considered.               
      President Reed moved that Resolutions       
 No. 298 - 304, 306 - 309, 311 and 312 be         
 adopted at this meeting of the Board.            
      Seconded by Mr. Conway.                     
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.          
      President Reed placed Resolution No.        
 305 on the First Reading of Resolutions          
 Calendar.                                        
           FIRST READING OF                       
             RESOLUTIONS                          
       Ms. Krewson moved to introduce             
 Resolution No. 305 and the clerk was             
 instructed to read same.                         
           Resolution No. 305                      
            MARY BARTLEY                           
     WHEREAS, the Polk Award recognizes            
the contributions of an individual that has        
consistently contributed leadership by             
example and contributions to the                   
neighborhood; and                                  
     WHEREAS, the Central West End                 
Association is honoring Mary Bartley, a long       
time resident of the 28th Ward, for her many       
contributions to the Ward and the City of St.      
Louis, as a whole; and                             
      WHEREAS, Mary has served the                 
Central West End Association as a volunteer        
since 1979. She is the driving force in building   
neighborhood support for maintaining historic      
standards; and                                     
     WHEREAS, Mary has been a valuable             
contributor to the growing stability of the        
neighborhoods; Faithfully serving the Central      
West End Association; Assuming the role of         
Executive Director, Vice President and             
President; and Serving on several Executive        
Committees: Arts and Beautification,               
Security, House Tour, Art Fair & Taste, and        
Balloon Glow; and                                  
      WHEREAS, Mary's commitment to the            
Planning & Development Committee has given         
the Committee stature and influence with           
cultural resources and with St. Louis City         
elected officials to ensure that the Central West  
End continues to improve and strengthen as a       
most desirable neighborhood in the region; and     
     WHEREAS, Mary is an outstanding               
example of an individual who is committed to       
the vision of a better City and is willing to      
personally dedicate herself to this task           
regardless of the time and effort needed; and      
      WHEREAS, in the late 1970's, prior to        
Forest Park Forever, Mary worked to clean          
up and fix up the bandstand in Forest Park.        
In the early 1980's she fought to keep the         
CWE neighborhood from breaking into four           
separate wards; In the early 1980's, she also      
worked to keep Kingshighway from                   
expanding two additional lanes thus impacting      
historic areas such as Holy Corners.               
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of               
the City of St. Louis, that we pause in our        
deliberations to recognize and congratulate        
Mary Bartley as one of this year's recipients      
of the Central West End Organization's Polk        
Award for leadership, dedication and               
community involvement; and we further join         
with the members of the 28th Ward                  
Organization in honoring Mary for her              
outstanding contributions to our City, and we      
direct the Clerk of the Board of Aldermen to       
spread a copy of this Resolution across the        
 minutes of this proceeding and to prepare a           
 commemorative copy to be presented to our             
 honoree at a time and place deemed appropriate        
 by the Sponsor.                                       
 Introduced on the 11th day of January, 2008           
 by:                                                   
 Honorable Lyda Krewson,Alderwoman 28th Ward           
      Unanimous consent having been                    
 obtained Resolution No. 305 stood                     
 considered.                                           
      Ms. Krewson moved that Resolution                
 No. 305. be adopted at this meeting of the            
 Board                                                 
       Seconded by Ms. Florida.                        
       Carried unanimously by voice vote.              
       Mr. Conway moved to introduce                   
 Resolution No. 310 and the clerk was                  
 instructed to read same.                              
            Resolution No. 310                         
      Assessor of the City of St. Louis                
      Reassessment of Real Property                    
       WHEREAS, The Office of the Assessor             
 of the City of St. Louis has completed its            
 reassessment of all real property located in          
 the City of St. Louis as required by state            
 statute and the State Tax Commission; and             
      WHEREAS, section 137.115 RSMo.                   
 provides for the maintenance of up-dated              
 assessments on an on-going basis pursuant to          
 an assessment and equalization maintenance            
 plan adopted by the local assessor; and               
       WHEREAS, under and by the authority             
 of section 137.115 RSMo., the governing body          
 of the City of St. Louis is required to approve       
 such assessment and equalization maintenance          
 plan for the maintenance of updated                   
 assessments; and                                      
       WHEREAS, the proposed maintenance               
 plan for the City of St. Louis for the period of      
 January 1, 2008 through December 31, 2009             
 has been prepared and is available for public         
 inspection in the office of the Clerk of the          
 Board of Aldermen; and                                
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                              
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                  
 the City of St. Louis that the assessment and         
 equalization maintenance plan prepared by             
 the Assessor is hereby approved as required           
 by law.                                               
 Introduced on the 11th day of January, 2008           
 by:                                                   
 Honorable Stephen Conway,Alderman 6th Ward            
 Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen  
       Mr. Conway sent Resolution No. 310              
 to the Committee on Ways & Means.                     
       Ms. Krewson moved to introduce           
 Resolution No. 313 and the clerk was           
 instructed to read same.                       
           Resolution No. 313                   
          TO APPROVE THE 2008                   
       WATERMAN-LAKE SPECIAL                    
     BUSINESS DISTRICT BUDGET                   
       WHEREAS, Waterman-Lake Special           
 Business District established by Ordinance     
 Number 63479, approved June 6, 1995 is         
 required under Section Seven thereof to file   
 with the Board of Aldermen its annual budget   
 for the funds collected by the Collector of    
 Revenue; and                                   
      WHEREAS,           the    Board    of     
 Commissioners of said District has met to      
 consider the budgetary requirements of the     
 Special Business District; and                 
      WHEREAS, said Board of                    
 Commissioners hereby submits the following     
 budget for the year beginning January 1, 2008  
 and ending December 31, 2008 for               
 consideration and approval by this Honorable   
 Board of Aldermen:                             
 REVENUE                                        
 Property Taxes                       $33,000   
 Interest                             $ 1,200   
 Contributions                        $ 2,500   
 TOTAL REVENUE                       $ 36,700   
 EXPENSES                                       
 Landscaping                          $ 5,000   
 Street Maintenance                   $ 5,000   
 Communications                                 
       Newsletter                     $ 500     
       Public Meetings                $ 500     
 Administration                       $ 1,000   
       Insurance                      $ 2,500   
 Utilities (street enhancements)                
       Electric                       $      500
       Sewer                          $      600
       Water                          $      550
 Miscellaneous                        $      500
       Spring picnic                            
       Christmas party                $      650
 TOTAL EXPENSES                       $17,300   
 PROJECTED SURPLUS                    $19,400   
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                      
 RESOLVED by this Honorable Board of            
 Alderman that the aforesaid submitted budget   
 is hereby approved.                            
 Introduced on the 11th day of January, 2008    
 by:                                            
 Honorable Lyda Krewson,Alderman 28th Ward      
 Unanimous consent having been obtained,        
 Resolution No. 313 stood considered.           
     Ms. Krewson moved that Resolution         
No. 313 be adopted at this meeting of the      
Board.                                         
     Seconded by Mr. Villa.                    
     Carried unanimously by voice vote.        
          SECOND READING                       
          OF RESOLUTIONS                       
     None.                                     
      MISCELLANEOUS AND                        
      UNFINISHED BUSINESS                      
     None.                                     
         ANNOUNCEMENTS                         
     None.                                     
       EXCUSED ALDERMEN                        
     Mr. Wessels moved to excuse the           
following aldermen due to their necessary      
absence: Ms. Triplett, Mr. Heitert and Ms.     
Davis.                                         
     Seconded by Mr. Villa.                    
     Carried unanimously by voice vote.        
             ADJOURNMENT                       
      Mr. Wessels moved to adjourn under       
rules to return January 18, 2008.              
     Seconded by Mr. Villa.                    
     Carried unanimously by voice vote.        
     Respectfully submitted,                   
     Denise Watson-Wesley Coleman              
     Clerk, Board of Aldermen                  
  BOARD OF                                     
PUBLIC SERVICE                                 
       REGULAR MEETING                         
 St. Louis, MO - January 15, 2008              
     Board met at 1:45 P.M.                    
     Present: Directors Greco, Bess,           
Siedhoff, Rice-Walker, Bryson and President    
Melton.                                        
     Absent: Directors Waelterman and          
Siedhoff. (excused)                            
     Requests of the Director of Streets and   
the Director of Human Services to be excused   
from the Regular Meeting of January 15, 2008   
was read and leaves of absence granted.        
     All actions pertaining to the Directors   
of Streets and Human Services shall be the     
Special Order of the Day by the Board.         
     Minutes of the Regular Meeting of         
January 8, 2008 were unanimously approved.     
               LETTINGS                        
     Ten sealed proposals for the public work  
 advertised under Letting No. 8349 - Delor        
 Avenue Reconstruction, were received,            
 publicly opened, read and referred to the        
 President.                                       
      Hearings were held on the following         
 matters:                                         
                 HEARINGS                         
      Hearing No. 8085 - J. Arthurs Salon, to     
 operate a massage or public bath establishment   
 at 1920 Park, permit, ordered approved           
 subject to the applicant receiving their         
 occupancy permit.                                
      Hearing No. 8086 - Eve's Garden Inc.,       
 to operate a massage or public bath              
 establishment at 3150 Morganford Road,           
 decision ordered tabled.                         
       Hearing No. 8087 - Emmanuel Outreach       
 Ministry, to operate a rooming house at 2125     
 Biddle (8 rooms), due to violation of Section    
 24.32.480, Section 903 of the Maintenance        
 Code which states "No such application shall     
 be approved wherein a church, elementary         
 school or secondary school is located within     
 the radius of five hundred feet plus one-half    
 of the width of the front of the premises, from  
 the center of such premises projected to the     
 streets, decision ordered tabled.                
       Hearing No. 8088 - Ranken Technical        
 College, to operate a dormitory at 4400-26       
 Page, due to violation of Section 24.32.480,     
 Section 903 of the Maintenance Code which        
 states "No such application shall be approved    
 wherein a church, elementary school or           
 secondary school is located within the radius    
 of five hundred feet plus one-half of the width  
 of the front of the premises, from the center    
 of such premises projected to the streets,       
 ordered approved.                                
       Communications, reports, recommenda-       
 tions and documents were submitted by Board      
 Members and action thereon taken as follows:     
                PRESIDENT                         
       Supplemental Agreement No. 10 to           
 P.S.A. No. 972 with Horner & Shifrin, for        
 Final Design for the Jefferson Avenue Viaduct    
 Reconstruction approved and President            
 authorized to execute same.                      
      P.S.A. No. 1049 with Horner & Shifrin       
 Inc., for Grand Avenue Streetscape               
 Enhancements, Chouteau to Park Avenue,           
 approved and President authorized to execute     
 same.                                            
      Resolution to revoke Encroachment           
 Permit for the pedestrian bridge which spans     
 from the Stadium West parking garage over        
 the City's public right-of-way along 8th north   
 of Clark and south of Walnut in the City         
 ordered approved.                                
       Indemnification Agreement by and        
 between the Board of Public Service and       
 Gateway Parking LLC and Ballpark Village      
 Holding Company LLC, agreeing that the City   
 shall not be liable and held harmless against 
 any liabilities ordered approved.             
     The Board declared as an emergency        
 work for Norman K. Probstein Golf Course      
 Outdoor Restroom.

 PUBLIC NOTICE                                 
    The Housing, Urban Development and         
Zoning Committee of the St. Louis Board of     
Aldermen will hold a Public Hearing on         
January 30, 2008 at 10:00 A.M. in the          
Kennedy Room (208) in City Hall:               
        BOARD BILL NO. 418                     
           Introduced By                       
      Alderman Joseph Roddy                    
     An ordinance establishing and creating a  
Planned Unit Development District for a        
portion of City Block 3893 to be known as      
the "City Walk on Euclid Planned Unit          
Development District".                         
     BOARD BILL NO. 432                        
        Introduced By                          
Alderwoman Kathleen Hanrahan                   
     An Ordinance recommended by the           
Planning Commission on December 5, 2007,       
to change the zoning of property as indicated  
on the District Map, from "A" Single-Family    
Dwelling District to the "F" Neighborhood      
Commercial District, in City Block 6124        
(6427R Chippewa), so as to include the         
described tract of land in City Block 6124;    
and containing an emergency clause.            
       BOARD BILL NO. 433                      
          Introduced By                        
    Alderwoman Marlene Davis                   
     An Ordinance recommended by the           
Planning Commission on December 5, 2007,       
 to change zoning of property as indicated on      
 the District Map, from "C" Multiple-Family        
 Dwelling District and "G" Local Commercial        
 and Office District to the "G" Local              
 Commercial and Office District only, in City      
 Block 6493 (1231 Blumeyer), so as to include      
 the described tract of land in City Block 6493;   
 and containing an emergency clause.               
      Any person wishing to speak for or           
 against the above cited board bills should be     
 present.                                          
  PUBLIC NOTICE                                    
     The Housing, Urban Development and            
 Zoning Committee of the St. Louis Board of        
 Aldermen will hold a Public Hearing on            
 January 30, 2008 at 10:00 A.M. in the             
 Kennedy Room (208) in City Hall:                  
         BOARD BILL NO. 343                        
            Introduced By                          
       Alderman Joseph Roddy                       
       An ordinance pertaining to Special Use      
 Districts; establishing The Grove Commercial      
 Area Special Use District (hereinafter the        
 "District"); providing definitions and findings   
 pertaining to said District; further providing    
 use and conditional use regulations for said      
 District; and containing an emergency clause.     
        BOARD BILL NO. 435                         
           Introduced By                           
     Alderwoman Lyda Krewson                       
       An ordinance recommended by the             
 Planning Commission and approving an              
 Amended and Restated Community Unit Plan          
 for an area located in the City of St. Louis and  
 comprising a portion of the Washington            
 University Danforth Campus; pledging              
 cooperation of the Board of Aldermen and          
 requesting various officials, departments,        
 boards and agencies of the City to cooperate      
 and to exercise their respective powers in a      
 manner consistent with the Community Unit         
 Plan; authorizing and directing the taking of     
 other actions, and approval and execution of      
 other documents as necessary or desirable to      
 carry out and comply with the intent hereof       
 and the Community Unit Plan.                      
         BOARD BILL NO. 443                        
            Introduced By                          
       Alderman Joseph Roddy                       
       An ordinance recommended by the             
 Planning Commission and approving a               
 Community Unit Plan for an area located in        
 the City of St. Louis and comprising a portion    
 of the Washington University Medical Center;      
 pledging cooperation of the Board of              
 Aldermen and requesting various officials,        
 departments, boards and agencies of the City      
 to cooperate and to exercise their respective     
 powers in a manner consistent with the           
 Community Unit Plan; authorizing and             
 directing the taking of other actions, and       
 approval and execution of other documents        
 as necessary or desirable to carry out and       
 comply with the intent hereof and the            
 Community Unit Plan.                             
      Any person wishing to speak for or          
 against the above cited board bills should be    
 present.                                         
     CITY OF ST. LOUIS                            
    LAMBERT-ST. LOUIS                             
 INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT(R)                         
  Request For Proposals for                       
       RISK MANAGEMENT                            
      CONSULTING SERVICES                         
      Sealed Proposals for Risk Management        
 Consulting Services will be received at          
 Lambert St. Louis International Airport(R),      
 Airport Contracts Office, 11495 Navaid           
 Road, Bridgeton, Missouri 63044 until 2:00       
 pm, February 26, 2008.                           
      Proposal documents may be obtained at       
 the above address Monday through Friday          
 between the hours of 8:30 am and 5:00 pm, or     
 by calling (314) 551-5055. This Request For      
 Proposals may be also obtained by visiting       
 our website at www.lambert-stlouis.com           
 (Click on "Business Opportunities")              
    The City encourages the utilization of        
 M/WBEs to the greatest extent possible.          
       This Request For Proposals is subject      
 to the St. Louis Living Wage Ordinance 65597     
 and the Regulations associated therewith.        
      Robert C. Salarano                          
      Contracts Administration Manager            
 DEPARTMENT OF                                    
  PERSONNEL                                       
     NOTICE OF EXAMINATIONS                       
      The City of St. Louis, Department of        
 Personnel, 1114 Market Street, Room 700,         
 announces competitive Civil Service              
 examinations to fill vacancies in the Municipal  
 Service.

 the following examination is FEBRUARY 8,         
 2008.

             Prom./O.C. 1445
